questions.questionText: 1. What is the primary purpose of the Bloc library in Flutter?
options: A. To manage UI widgets directly
B. To handle network requests efficiently
C. To simplify navigation between screens
D. To manage application state

questions.questionText: 2. Which of the following concepts is central to Bloc state management?
options: A. Streams
B. Widgets
C. Gestures
D. Navigators

questions.questionText: 3. How does a Bloc emit new states to the UI?
options: A. By calling the setState() method
B. By using the Navigator class
C. By yielding values in the mapEventToState method
D. By directly updating the widget tree

questions.questionText: 4. What is the role of BlocBuilder in a Flutter app?
options: A. To create and manage Bloc instances
B. To listen to state changes and rebuild UI accordingly
C. To handle user interactions and events
D. To navigate between different screens

questions.questionText: 5. Which of the following is a key difference between Bloc and Cubit?
options: A. Cubits are more complex than Blocs
B. Blocs use streams, while Cubits do not
C. Cubits are only used for simple state management
D. Blocs cannot be tested easily

questions.questionText: 6. When should you consider using a BlocProvider?
options: A. To make a Bloc instance available to child widgets
B. To manage the lifecycle of a Bloc
C. To test a Bloc in isolation
D. To create a new Bloc instance

questions.questionText: 7. What is the purpose of the emit() method in a Bloc?
options: A. To send events to the Bloc
B. To update the current state
C. To trigger a rebuild of the UI
D. To dispose of the Bloc

questions.questionText: 8. How can you handle asynchronous operations within a Bloc?
options: A. By using the async and await keywords
B. By using the FutureBuilder widget
C. By using the StreamBuilder widget
D. All of the above

questions.questionText: 9. What is the recommended way to test Blocs in Flutter?
options: A. Using unit tests
B. Using integration tests
C. Using widget tests
D. All of the above

questions.questionText: 10. What are some benefits of using Bloc for state management?
options: A. Improved testability
B. Better separation of concerns
C. Enhanced code readability
D. All of the above
